original: @232a * // 'dul ba lung bla ma'i bye brag lung zhu ba'i 'grel pa bzhugs //
analyzed: @232a * // 'dul ba lung bla ma'i bye brag lung zhu ba'i 'grel pa bzhugs //
translated: The commentary on the request for the transmission of the higher transmission of the Vinaya.

original: # // gal te 'o na ji ltar bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs na sbyor bar byas pa tsam gyi dbang gis dge tshul gyi gnas skabs na sbyor ba med pa ltung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: # // gal te 'o na ji ltar bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs na sbyor bar byas pa tsam gyi dbang gis dge tshul gyi gnas skabs na sbyor ba med pa ltung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow is it that at the time of full ordination, by the power of merely engaging in the act, at the time of novice monk, not engaging in the act becomes a downfall?‚Äù

original: 'di la yang smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang smra bar bya ste /
translated: One should say this in response:

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs na sbyor ba byas pa'i dbang gis dge tshul gyi gnas skabs na bdag gi ngo bor gyur pa kho nas /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs na sbyor ba byas pa'i dbang gis dge tshul gyi gnas skabs na bdag gi ngo bor gyur pa kho nas /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the power of engaging in the act at the time of full ordination, at the time of novice monk, by the power of merely becoming his nature,

original: de'i dus pa'i sbyor ba med pa yang dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba nyes byas zhes bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dus pa'i sbyor ba med pa yang dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba nyes byas zhes bya ba 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: even not engaging in the act at that time is established as a root downfall and a minor offense.‚Äù

original: gal te bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs sam /
analyzed: gal te bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas skabs sam /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúAt the time of full ordination,

original: dge tshul gyi gnas skabs nas khyim pa nyid kyi gnas skabs par gyur na /
analyzed: dge tshul gyi gnas skabs nas khyim pa nyid kyi gnas skabs par gyur na /
translated: or at the time of novice monk, if one becomes a layperson,üîΩdoes a downfall occur at that time?‚Äù

original: ci de na yang 'di la ltung ba 'byung ngam zhe na de ni med de /
analyzed: ci de na yang 'di la ltung ba 'byung ngam zhe na de ni med de /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe dge tshul gyi gnas skabs nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe dge tshul gyi gnas skabs nas /
translated: Thus, when a novice monk

original: khyim pa @232b nyid kyi gnas skabs par gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: khyim pa @232b nyid kyi gnas skabs par gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: becomes a layperson,

original: 'di'i sngon gyi gnas skabs nyams pas bdag gi ngo bor gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i sngon gyi gnas skabs nyams pas bdag gi ngo bor gyur pa yin no //
translated: his former status is lost and he becomes a layperson.

original: bdag gi ngo bor gyur na yang 'di la khyim pa'i gnas skabs na ltung ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi ngo bor gyur na yang 'di la khyim pa'i gnas skabs na ltung ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he becomes a layperson, he would not commit a transgression in the state of a layperson.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bdag gi ngo bor gyur pas dge tshul gyi gnas skabs na ltung ba yang nyes byas zhes bya ba la dge slong gi gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba'i dbang can gyi kha na ma thob slong bar shes par bya'o //üîΩde ltar ma yin na dge slong gi gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba'i dbang can gyi kha na ma tho ba /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bdag gi ngo bor gyur pas dge tshul gyi gnas skabs na ltung ba yang nyes byas zhes bya ba la dge slong gi gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba'i dbang can gyi kha na ma thob slong bar shes par bya'o // de ltar ma yin na dge slong gi gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba'i dbang can gyi kha na ma tho ba /
translated: Therefore, when he becomes a layperson, he should understand that the transgression of a novice monk is a minor offense in the context of a monk.

original: dge tshul gyi gnas skabs na ltung ba yang nyes byas zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: dge tshul gyi gnas skabs na ltung ba yang nyes byas zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it were not so, then the transgression of a novice monk would not be a minor offense in the context of a monk.

original: 'di ltar de ni ltung ba lci ba nyes pa sbom po zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni ltung ba lci ba nyes pa sbom po zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba yin pas so //
translated: Thus it is called a serious downfall and a grave fault.

original: da ni 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now this should be stated:üîΩIf a layperson is urged to confess a fault called a slight fault,

original: gal te khyim pa nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba tsam gyi dbang gis dge tshul gyi gnas skabs na /
analyzed: gal te khyim pa nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba tsam gyi dbang gis dge tshul gyi gnas skabs na /
translated: a downfall that is a minor offense when a layperson, due to the influence of merely the preparation of the state of a layperson,üîΩbut is not a fault at that time when a novice,üîΩthen what is the fault for a layperson?

original: de'i dus pa'i sbyor ba med par kha na ma tho ba na smad pa nyes byas zhes bya ba slong bar brjod na de khyim pa'i gnas skabs na kha na ma tho ba ci zhig tu 'gyur /üîΩde bzhin du dge tshul gyi gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba tsam gyi dbang gis /
analyzed: de'i dus pa'i sbyor ba med par kha na ma tho ba na smad pa nyes byas zhes bya ba slong bar brjod na de khyim pa'i gnas skabs na kha na ma tho ba ci zhig tu 'gyur / de bzhin du dge tshul gyi gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba tsam gyi dbang gis /
translated: Similarly, if a novice is urged to confess a fault called a serious downfall,üîΩa downfall that is a grave fault when a novice, due to the influence of merely the preparation of the state of a novice,

original: dge slong gi gnas skabs na de'i dus pa'i sbyor ba med par kha na ma tho ba lci ba nyes pa sbom po zhes bya ba slong bar brjod na /
analyzed: dge slong gi gnas skabs na de'i dus pa'i sbyor ba med par kha na ma tho ba lci ba nyes pa sbom po zhes bya ba slong bar brjod na /
translated: but is not a fault at that time when a fully ordained monk,

original: de dge tshul gyi gnas skabs na ltung ba ci zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: de dge tshul gyi gnas skabs na ltung ba ci zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: then what is the downfall for a novice?

original: de bzhin du dge slong gi gnas skabs na de'i dus pa'i sbyor ba med par kha na ma tho ba lci ba nyes byas zhes bya ba slong bar brjod na sbyor ba ni ltung ba cir 'gyur zhe na /üîΩ'di la kha cig na re re zhig khyim pa nyid kyi gnas skabs na sbyor ba byed pa la ni ltung ba slong ba mi srid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong gi gnas skabs na de'i dus pa'i sbyor ba med par kha na ma tho ba lci ba nyes byas zhes bya ba slong bar brjod na sbyor ba ni ltung ba cir 'gyur zhe na / 'di la kha cig na re re zhig khyim pa nyid kyi gnas skabs na sbyor ba byed pa la ni ltung ba slong ba mi srid de /
translated: So too, if one who is a fully ordained monk confesses a serious offense that is a downfall that is not a downfall for one who is not a fully ordained monk, what is the basis of his downfall?

original: 'di ltar khyim pa rnams la ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir dang / khyim pa la bsod nams ma yin pa mang po skye ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyim pa rnams la ltung ba rnam par gzhag pa med pa'i phyir dang / khyim pa la bsod nams ma yin pa mang po skye ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Some say: It is impossible for one who is a layperson to confess a downfall because he has not taken the vows and because it is said that only a layperson can generate much nonvirtue.

original: dge tshul gyi gnas skabs na shin tu smad pa nyes byas su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dge tshul gyi gnas skabs na shin tu smad pa nyes byas su shes par bya ste /
translated: It should be recognized as a very reprehensible offense for one who is a novice monk.

original: 'di ltar gang la nyes byas na smad pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la nyes byas na smad pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because it is a basis of deprecation.

original: dge slong gi gnas skabs na yang sbyor ba med na sbom po kho nar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi gnas skabs na yang sbyor ba med na sbom po kho nar shes par bya ste /
translated: If one who is a fully ordained monk confesses a serious offense, it should be recognized as a serious downfall.

original: 'di ltar dngos gzhir sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos gzhir sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it is preparation for the actual basis.

original: 'di ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa gzhan dag mi 'dod de /üîΩ'di ltar gang la phyis dge tshul la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba sngon @233a * //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa gzhan dag mi 'dod de / 'di ltar gang la phyis dge tshul la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba sngon @233a * //
translated: Other upholders of the vinaya do not assert this.üîΩBecause when one is a fully ordained monk and so on, the actual basis of a heinous act is posited as the cause of preparation for a layperson and so on.

original: khyim pa nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu can rnam par gzhag pa dang / de bzhin du phyi ma dge tshul la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na snga ma dge slong la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu can rnam par gzhag pa de /
analyzed: khyim pa nyid la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu can rnam par gzhag pa dang / de bzhin du phyi ma dge tshul la sogs pa'i gnas skabs na snga ma dge slong la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu can rnam par gzhag pa de /
translated: And when one is a novice and so on, the actual basis of a heinous act is posited as the cause of preparation for a fully ordained monk and so on.

original: des sbyor ba rgyun chad pa'am sbyor ba rgyun ma chad pa zhig las 'gyur gang na /
analyzed: des sbyor ba rgyun chad pa'am sbyor ba rgyun ma chad pa zhig las 'gyur gang na /
translated: Does this occur when the preparation is severed or when the preparation is not severed?

original: de la re zhig gal te sbyor ba can bcad na /
analyzed: de la re zhig gal te sbyor ba can bcad na /
translated: First, if the preparation is severed,

original: de lta na ni sbyor ba med pa'i phyir dngos gzhi mi slong ba kho na ste /
analyzed: de lta na ni sbyor ba med pa'i phyir dngos gzhi mi slong ba kho na ste /
translated: then the actual basis is not generated because there is no preparation.

original: ma bsams par bsad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma bsams par bsad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is like killing without intention.

original: de skad du yang bdag nyid 'chir bcug pa bzlog pa'i skabs su rnam par 'byed pa las /üîΩgal te des 'di skad du tshe dang ldan pa khyod bdag nyid gsod par ma byed cig /'chi bar ma byed cig /'tsho ba dang 'bral bar ma byed cig ces smra ba las ci ste de bdag nyid gsod par byed 'chi bar byed /
analyzed: de skad du yang bdag nyid 'chir bcug pa bzlog pa'i skabs su rnam par 'byed pa las / gal te des 'di skad du tshe dang ldan pa khyod bdag nyid gsod par ma byed cig /'chi bar ma byed cig /'tsho ba dang 'bral bar ma byed cig ces smra ba las ci ste de bdag nyid gsod par byed 'chi bar byed /
translated: The Vinaya Verses states in the section on preventing suicide:

original: bdag nyid srog dang bral bar byed na sngon gyi sbyor ba de nyid kyis 'chir 'jug pa de la nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag nyid srog dang bral bar byed na sngon gyi sbyor ba de nyid kyis 'chir 'jug pa de la nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: If he says, ‚ÄúVenerable, do not kill yourself, do not die, do not separate from life,‚Äù but he kills himself, dies and separates from life, then due to that prior preparation, he commits a serious offense.

original: 'on te sbyor ba rgyun ma bcad na de lta na sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir dang / bsams pa'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dang / dngos gzhi yongs su rdzogs pa kho nar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te sbyor ba rgyun ma bcad na de lta na sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir dang / bsams pa'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir dang / dngos gzhi yongs su rdzogs pa kho nar 'gyur na /
translated: If the preparation is not severed, then because the preparation exists and the result of the intention is complete, it becomes only the actual basis.

original: ji ltar na smad pa zhes bya /üîΩgal te de'i tshe sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na smad pa zhes bya / gal te de'i tshe sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: How is it reprehensible?

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you say it is because there is no preparation at that time,üîΩthen it is logical that it would be reprehensible.

original: dge slong gang zhig gis dgra bsad pa'i phyir sbyor ba byas nas kyang lo bcu'am nyi shu 'das nas dgra de srog dang bral na /
analyzed: dge slong gang zhig gis dgra bsad pa'i phyir sbyor ba byas nas kyang lo bcu'am nyi shu 'das nas dgra de srog dang bral na /
translated: If a monk were to prepare to kill an enemy, and then after ten or twenty years had passed, the enemy were to die,

original: dge slong de la de'i tshe da ltar byung ba'i sbyor ba 'ga' yang med pas de yang dngos gzhi med par thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: dge slong de la de'i tshe da ltar byung ba'i sbyor ba 'ga' yang med pas de yang dngos gzhi med par thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then at that time, the monk would have no present preparation at all, and so it would follow that he would not have the actual basis of the offense.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not logical.

original: sngon gyi sbyor ba rgyun ma bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi sbyor ba rgyun ma bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the former preparation is not severed.

original: ji ltar 'di de'i tshe sbyor ba rgyun ma bcad pa yin par 'dod pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di de'i tshe sbyor ba rgyun ma bcad pa yin par 'dod pa ltar /
translated: Just as it is accepted that at that time the preparation is not severed,

original: de'i sbyor ba yang de'i tshe de dang 'dra bar 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba yang de'i tshe de dang 'dra bar 'dod par bya'o //
translated: so it should be accepted that the preparation for that offense is similar at that time.

original: de bzhin du gal te gnas skabs gzhan na byas pa'i sbyor ba gnas skabs gzhan na med do zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te gnas skabs gzhan na byas pa'i sbyor ba gnas skabs gzhan na med do zhe na /
translated: In the same way, if it is said that the preparation that is done in one state does not exist in another state,

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: then even so,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur te //
translated: there is an absurd consequence.

original: gang zhig gis dge slong nyid kyi tshe pham pa'i ltung ba byung nas khyim pa nyid du 'phos na de gnas skabs gzhan du byas pa'i pham pa'i ltung ba med pas yang rab tu 'byung ba dang sdom pa'i zhing nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gis dge slong nyid kyi tshe pham pa'i ltung ba byung nas khyim pa nyid du 'phos na de gnas skabs gzhan du byas pa'i pham pa'i ltung ba med pas yang rab tu 'byung ba dang sdom pa'i zhing nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one who has committed a defeating offense while a fully ordained monk then changes sex and becomes a layperson, it would follow that he would become a suitable basis for the vows and go forth again because he would not have committed a defeating offense in another state.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: de ni sdom pa'i zhing ma @233b yin pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang las gcig gis 'phangs pa nyid kyi rigs mthun pa gcig pa'i phyir gzhon nu dang dar la bab pa dang rgan po nyid la sogs pa bzhin du gnas skabs rnams kyi rten tha dad par byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: de ni sdom pa'i zhing ma @233b yin pa nyid dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang las gcig gis 'phangs pa nyid kyi rigs mthun pa gcig pa'i phyir gzhon nu dang dar la bab pa dang rgan po nyid la sogs pa bzhin du gnas skabs rnams kyi rten tha dad par byed pa ma yin na /
translated: Because it is related to the state of not being a basis for vows.üîΩMoreover, just as youth, adulthood, and old age are not different bases of the states of youth, adulthood, and old age because they are projected by the same karma and are of the same type,

original: ji ltar gnas skabs gzhan na byas pa'i sbyor ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas skabs gzhan na byas pa'i sbyor ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: how could the states of youth, adulthood, and old age be bases that are different?

original: de lta bas na gnas skabs ni gnyis te rab tu byung ba bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na gnas skabs ni gnyis te rab tu byung ba bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, there are two states: the state of being a renunciate who is not fully ordained and the state of being fully ordained.

original: des na rab tu byung ba bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dge tshul gang zhig gis rku ba'i phyir pho nyas rku ba'i sbyor ba byas nas bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa de la dge slong gi dngos por khas len pa'i dus na sbyor ba rgyun bcad pa yin
analyzed: des na rab tu byung ba bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dge tshul gang zhig gis rku ba'i phyir pho nyas rku ba'i sbyor ba byas nas bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa de la dge slong gi dngos por khas len pa'i dus na sbyor ba rgyun bcad pa yin
translated: Therefore, if a renunciate who is not fully ordained, a novice monk, sends a messenger to steal, and while the novice is in the process of being fully ordained, the novice becomes a fully ordained monk, at the time of accepting the status of a fully ordained monk, the process of the act of stealing is severed.

original: no // sbyor ba las byung pa'i nyes byas dang mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: no // sbyor ba las byung pa'i nyes byas dang mi ldan pa'o //
translated: He does not possess the misdeed that arises from the process of the act.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa de na sngon byed du bcug pa'i pho nyas brkus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba de mthar phyin par byed mod kyi /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa de na sngon byed du bcug pa'i pho nyas brkus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba de mthar phyin par byed mod kyi /
translated: If the fully ordained monk who previously instigated the act of stealing by sending a messenger completes the act of stealing,

original: 'on kyang rtsa ba'i kha na ma tho ba slong bar byed pa ni mi 'gyur te sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtsa ba'i kha na ma tho ba slong bar byed pa ni mi 'gyur te sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he does not incur the root downfall of stealing because he did not engage in the process of the act.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes byas gang yin pa de ni 'di'i nyes pa sbom por 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes byas gang yin pa de ni 'di'i nyes pa sbom por 'gyur te /
translated: Any misdeed arising from preparation is a serious violation for him.

original: pham pa'i sbyor ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa dag la nyes pa sbom por bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pham pa'i sbyor ba ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa dag la nyes pa sbom por bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the preparation for a root downfall is taught as a serious violation for those fully ordained.

original: de bzhin du bsnyen par rdzogs pa pham pa'i sbyor ba byas nas sbyor ba rgyun bcad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsnyen par rdzogs pa pham pa'i sbyor ba byas nas sbyor ba rgyun bcad de /
translated: Similarly, if one who is fully ordained prepares to commit a root downfall, but then stops,

original: gal te dge tshul nyid du 'phos na de lta na dngos gzhi slong bar byed pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: gal te dge tshul nyid du 'phos na de lta na dngos gzhi slong bar byed pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: and if he then becomes a novice, then the misdeed arising from preparation for the actual basis is a serious violation.

original: 'di'i nyes byas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di'i nyes byas su 'gyur te /
translated: It is a minor offense for him.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams la ni nyes byas tsam du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams la ni nyes byas tsam du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught that it is a minor offense for those not fully ordained.

original: de ltar na 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i gzhung lugs 'di gnyis ni dge slong ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma rnams kyis sbyor ba'i dbang gis gsod pa la sogs pa bdun tshan 'chad par 'gyur ba dag la yang mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dul ba 'dzin pa'i gzhung lugs 'di gnyis ni dge slong ma dang / dge slob ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma rnams kyis sbyor ba'i dbang gis gsod pa la sogs pa bdun tshan 'chad par 'gyur ba dag la yang mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these two scriptural traditions of the Vinaya masters should be inferred to be just as they are explained in the seven sets of rules for nuns, probationary nuns, novices, and female novices.üîΩI will not explain them here because it would require too many words.

original: gzhung mang po nyid du 'gyur bas bdag gis ni rnam par mi bshad do / sho gam zhes bya ba ni gser la sogs pa'i dbyig la rgyal po'i skal ba'o //
analyzed: gzhung mang po nyid du 'gyur bas bdag gis ni rnam par mi bshad do / sho gam zhes bya ba ni gser la sogs pa'i dbyig la rgyal po'i skal ba'o //
translated: A toll is a king's share of gold and so on.

original: nam mkha' las zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' las gsang sngags dang sman dang / mi ma yin pa mngags pa dang / shing las 'phangs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' las zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' las gsang sngags dang sman dang / mi ma yin pa mngags pa dang / shing las 'phangs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: From the sky means from the sky, such as when a mantra, medicine, nonhuman being, or tree is thrown.

original: bzlas na zhes bya ba ni khyer na'o //üîΩdngos po ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzlas na zhes bya ba ni khyer na'o // dngos po ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la /

translated: Or, if it is mantra and so on, means that one goes near to the object of theft with the intention of stealing it, by the method of pleasing with mantra, flowers, and fruit, or by the method of subjugation, because one goes again and again to the presence of the owner.üîΩTherefore, it is the act of taking what is given by the owner, whether or not the owner is subjugated by mantra and so on.

analyzed: 'di skad du zer ba dag kyang yod de /

translated: If one obtains wealth through mantras and so on for the purpose of pleasing others, then one's intention is impaired through the power of attachment when one obtains wealth through mantras and so on for the purpose of pleasing others.

original: gtogs pa'i nyes bya sa la sogs pa ni 'ga' yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtogs pa'i nyes bya sa la sogs pa ni 'ga' yang ma yin te /

analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni de yongs su mgu nas byin pa gang yin pa de len to // dbang du bya ba'i tshul du gsang sngags la sogs pas nye bar 'gro bas thob pa'i nor la nor rku sems kyis spyod na bcings pa dang brdeg pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyis dbang med par byas nas sbyin du 'jug pa ji lta bar gsang sngags la sogs
translated: Because one accepts that which is given by others who are pleased.üîΩIf one uses wealth obtained through mantras and so on for the purpose of subjugating others, with the thought to steal that wealth, then one is like someone who forces others to give through the power of such means as binding and beating.
